alert.note: Alert for Larimer County Below 6000 Feet, Northwest Weld County; Larimer and Boulder Counties Between 6000 and 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 30 at 6:23PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Weld and northeastern Larimer Counties through 700 PM MDT... At 623 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles west of Natural Fort, or 17 miles southwest of Cheyenne, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Carr and Natural Fort. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare for sudden gusty winds. Secure loose objects and move to a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Larimer County Below 6000 Feet, Northwest Weld County; Larimer and Boulder Counties Between 6000 and 9000 Feet
